job_description: Regulatory Data Analyst - job post Marsh Consulting Services Chicago, IL 60642 • Hybrid remote $30 - $36 an hour -  Contract Responded to 75% or more applications in the past 30 days, typically within 12 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $30 - $36 an hour Job Type Contract long term hybrid contract, must be local to office, probably just 1 day per week in office As a member of Scientific & Regulatory Affairs (SRA), the incumbent is responsible for screening, tracking and maintaining regulatory information on ingredients at our client. Accurate and complete ingredient information is the foundation for regulatory compliance of the finished product and labeling. In addition to ensuring data accuracy and completeness, the incumbent will leverage ingredient and regulatory knowledge to critically evaluate data quality to ingredient composition, nutrition and other key regulatory information is consistent. Success in this role will require stakeholder management and collaboration at a global and regional level, both within the SRA function and cross-functionally. The incumbent will work closely with other global SRA associates to evaluate performance against the metrics and drive continuous improvement. Key Responsibilities Screen and approve new ingredient per the aligned service level agreement to ensure data accuracy and completeness Obtain updated ingredient information per aligned business priority and cadence Interface with regional SRA, R&D and Specification teams to continuously improve specification and recipe systems Track key ingredient screening metrics to drive continuous improvement Support regulatory change management by performing key ingredient searches in the database to evaluate impact of regulatory change Attend necessary project and meetings in order to communicate progress and opportunity for improvement Context and Scope The incumbent applies technical, organizational, and project managerial skills broadly to screen and approve ingredients and collaborates with cross-functional stakeholders in regional SRA, R&D and Specification teams. The incumbent works with a high level of independence, based on regulatory knowledge and experience, to make decisions and deploy best practices that assure global compliance of ingredients and mitigate regulatory risks. Education Minimum: A Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition, Food Science, Food Safety, or Food Process Engineering is required. Knowledge/Experience 2-3 years' experience in regulatory affairs at a food, beverage, or consumer products company is required International regulatory experience is a preferred High degree of ownership with strong sense of urgency and an action-biased, positive attitude Good critical thinking, able to operate independently Demonstrated team collaboration competencies, with strong organization and complex problem solving skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, self-directed, forward thinking, and ability to make recommendations with limited information/data Ability to quickly adapt, learn on the fly and understand complex processes and concepts Ability to challenge status quo of current ways of working to build robust new ideas Job Type: Contract Pay: $30.00 - $36.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: Regulatory food compliance: 3 years (Preferred) Data analysis skills: 3 years (Preferred) Work Location: Hybrid remote in Chicago, IL 60642 If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Data Scientist/Analyst - job post DSMH LLC Chicago, IL 60661 $50 - $55 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $50 - $55 an hour Job Type Contract Position will be onsite hybrid in Chicago, in office about once a week. Position’s Contributions to Work Group This position will help with Analytics in particular to asset utilization including hours, location, and other telemetry data. The candidate will work on a variety of tasks including data pipeline, documentation, and model development so Client can continue to lead in the space of asset utilization. This effort might also involve work on forecasting, so understanding of forecasting techniques is a plus. Typical Day Typical day for this position includes a mix of meetings and individual contribution, with occasional travel (if approved) to participate in-person workshops. Candidate is expected to participate in twice a week stand-up, product and release reviews, and also with individual team members to build knowledge. Education Requirements: Bachelors degree, preferably in engineering, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or a similar field with quantitative coursework, required plus 8+ years exp. Masters degree with 5+ years exp also accepted. Technical Skills Required: *Python - 5+ years of experience applying python libraries Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn, Keras, and TensorFlow to solve business challenges *2+ years exp with Snowflake and SQL * Experience with advanced data analysis and statistical methods such as regression, hypothesis testing, ANOVA, statistical process control, etc. * Familiarity with Agile (scrum, tickets, sprint, reviews) *Must be competent with analytics, forecasting techniques and tools. *Must be comfortable working in industry standard statistics, analytics, and data visualization packages. Desired: *Practical applications of machine learning techniques such as Clustering, Logistic Regression, Random Forests, SVM, K-Means, PCA, XGBoost, and Neural Networks. *Azure DevOps *Experience with cloud technologies, AWS Job Type: Contract Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Data Analyst - job post Infinity Consulting Solutions, Inc. 37 reviews Chicago, IL 60603 • Hybrid remote $40 - $60 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $40 - $60 an hour Job Type Contract $45/hr As our world becomes more data driven, data analysts with strong technical skills are becoming absolutely essential to the practice of law. In this role, the selected candidate will be on the front line of law and data analytics. This position can reside in either Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Philadelphia, Washington DC office with a hybrid in-office/remote working schedule. Must work 10:00am-7:00pm CST hours Responsibilities: Work in a collaborative team environment to support attorneys and paralegals on a wide variety of complex business and legal issues Access, parse, and load complex data sets from small text files to large databases from enterprise applications quickly, efficiently, and accurately Perform data engineering, modeling, and analytic tasks to facilitate client reporting capabilities, enhance dashboards, and provide actionable data and insightful analysis Join attorneys on client meetings to lead technical discussions including output file definition, input file requirements, and general interpretation of data Mentor, teach, share knowledge and analytic techniques with your colleagues Education and experience: Minimum of three years of relevant experience in developing analytic solutions with proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, or similar data analysis and ETL tools Bachelor's degree (B.S./B.A.) in an appropriate field from an accredited college or university Preferred experience in developing client facing visualizations and reports using Power BI, SSRS or similar visualization tools is a plus Preferred knowledge of coding in Python, R, DAX and/or M Preferred experience in developing SSIS and/or SSAS solutions Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey highly complex technical concepts down to actionable objectives to advise stakeholders including attorneys, firm management, and firm colleagues Experience in project management including planning, organizing, and supervising clients and colleagues towards successful project completion Demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment Expert level of proficiency with T-SQL or equivalent including a high level of proficiency in database administration High proficiency with Microsoft Excel including an ability to create pivot tables, power pivots & queries, formulas, and external data connections Ability to design and implement ETL solutions About Infinity Consulting Solutions At Infinity Consulting Solutions our mission is to cultivate successful long term relationships with candidates and clients matching the right candidate with the right client. We believe technology cannot replace the real personal relationships we cultivate. We reject the notion that technology alone is the answer to staffing which is why we our successful partnerships rely on collaboration NOT automation. ICS has been providing flexible staffing solutions for over 20 years in Information Technology, Compliance, Accounting / Finance and Corporate Support. Our staffing solutions include Contract, Temp to Perm and Permanent Placement. ICS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. W2 employees of ICS are offered comprehensive benefits including health, dental and vision.
